page.title: 08ARGAL RESERVOIR
page.content: Argal Reservoir has a capacity of 1350,000000 l.It has no river supply into it.The water is worked at College which part of the Argal complex.The reservoir was built in 1940 and was raised in 1961. The dam is 136.6m long and its overflow level is 82.3 m.There are occasional visits by College works and fisheries staff and the reservoir is inspected every 10 years.The last inspection was in 1981. The Water Board put rainbow trout in the reservoir so that people may fish there.Rowing boats are available and wind surfing also takes place. There is a pleasent walk around the reservoir through woodlands where there are many flowers.There is a picnic site with tables and toilets and a lovely view of the reservoir.
